cold sandwiches.name: Salami, Mozzarella + Roasted Red Pepper Sandwich

make it.step-one: Use a serrated knife to cut the Italian sub roll in half. Place sub roll on butcher or wax paper and drizzle both sides with a really nice olive oil.
make it.step-two: Add mozzarella to one-half and sprinkle with salt
make it.step-three: Add roasted red peppers, genoa salami, and a handful of fresh washed basil.
make it.step-four: Close the sandwich and tightly wrap the butcher or wax paper around it. Roll and cut down the middle. Serve immediately or wrap it up for later. ​The sandwich is good for 24 hours if refrigerated properly.

cold sandwiches.name: Caprese Sandwich with Tomato, Mozzarella + Fresh Basil

make it.step-one: Using a serrated knife, slice an Italian sub roll in half.
make it.step-two: Drizzle the inside with Italian extra virgin olive oil and balsamic glaze.
make it.step-three: Add basil and tomato to one side and sprinkle with salt and pepper
